thread.title: W.H.E.E.L.S. Top Knights; Win M.T.G. Chip In OT
thread.title_full: W.H.E.E.L.S. Top Knights; Win M.T.G. Chip In OT

title: W.H.E.E.L.S. Top Knights; Win M.T.G. Chip In OT
text: W.H.E.E.L.S. Top Knights; Win M.T.G. Chip In OT Maurice Wingate Talk about it in the nychoops Message Boards FLUSHING, NY - The championship game of the More Than a Game Pre-High School Invitational took place at John Bowne HS on Sunday. In an overtime nail biter, the W.H.E.E.L.S. Wolves would best the Knights of Holy Cross, 68-66.The Manhattan PSAL AA looked at the onset to match the physicality of their Flushing, NY Catholic School counterpart. Holy Cross used speed early as opposed to physicality as Jamel Horton '16 (24 points) and sharpshooter Chaz Platt '16 (15 points) scored in transition. The Knights led 12-3 HC with 11:46.W.H.E.E.L.S. seemed to be falling deeper into the abyss when Horton scored off the dribble at the 9 minutes mark but the Wolves managed to recoup some of their losses. 8:19 remained in half and Holy Cross still led but Marisana Camara '16 (7 points) scored a nice scoop shot that help cut an 11 point lead to 7.The Knights would push their lead back to double digits as Pratt drained a perimeter shot with 3:45 but W.H.E.E.L.S. countered as Emilio Cerda '16 (25 points) knocked it down to 23-21 with 2:19 with back-to-back-to-back buckets. Gary Rivera '17 (6 points) soon tied the game at 23.Horton uncorked the tie, going 1-2 from the line. With 58.4 seconds left in the half, Pierre Jones '17 (1 point) tied the game going 1-2 as well. Now tied at 24, Elijah Harris '16 (11 points) regained the lead for the Knights, shooting pure from the charity stripe but Cerda scored at the buzzer putting W.H.E.E.L.S. up, 27-26 at the half.At the top of the second half, Cerda extends W.H.E.E.L.S. lead with a leaner and after a defensive stand, Rivera and forward Marlon Moreta '17 (15 points) pushed the Wolves lead to 34-26 with 13:52.The Knights finally stopped W.H.E.E.L.S.'s 7-0 run from the foul line but still trailed 38-28 with 11:30 as W.H.E.E.L.S. countered. Moreta did work on the offensive boards and pumped W.H.E.E.L.S. up to a 42-30 advantage with 10:45 left in the game.Holy Cross sought to inch back into the game as Horton scored a tough hoop off a drive. The Knights trapped and Moreta still managed to get open but Cross continued to grind and got W.H.E.E.L.S. lead down to 47-40. W.H.E.E.L.S. did counter but there was a momentum shift in the air. A three by Horton with 8:10 sliced the Wolves lead to 49-43. 21 made a further dent in W.H.E.E.L.S. lead. 49-45 with 7 minutes.Camara puts up points from the charity strip and then initiate a man defense. Moreta scores. 52-45 with 6:11. Sadhique Watkins '18 (4 points) comes in and immediately cuts lead back to four but Moreta responds. Horton slashes in for an and1 with 5:29. 55-51. Harris pulls HC to within 55-53 with 3:50. Hassan Diarra '17 (5 points) give Holy Cross its first lead, 56-55, with 2 minutes but W.H.E.E.L.S. responded. A Knights turnover and missed free-throw attempt gave W.H.E.E.L.S. a chance to extend and Raheem Ragsdale scored giving W.H.E.E.L.S. a 3 point lead. A defensive lapse however left Harris open for three with 35.7 to knot the game at 59.W.H.E.E.L.S. missed a chance to score but retained possession with 7.1 seconds. Unable to get a shot off, Holy Cross had .7 secs left to score but couldn't get it done. The game went into a 2 minute overtime tied at 59.The Knights scored off the tip off but Camara countered. Platt, who suffered from leg cramp throughout the game, netted a trey giving Holy Cross a 64-61 advantage with 1:30.Moreta scored and Camara drives hard left and gives W.H.E.E.L.S. 66-65 lead 25.5 as teammates yelled "eat him." Platt draws a foul with 10.6 seconds left in the first OT. The senior hits the first but misses the second free-throw. Knotted at 66-66 with 8 seconds, Rivera scores a putback with 1.8 remaining. Holy Cross would not be able to counter. FEATURED PRODUCTS
